intro: Hieracium osorense, commonly known as the Osorensis Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showing adaptability to harsh environments. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a rosette pattern, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
